GT.content: link btwn morality & calculation of pleasure equivocates good intentions, precipitates gift towards its end, is its very apocalypse [Hamacher], truth of gift > end of gift
GT.linkedContent: link btwn morality & calculation of pleasure equivocates good intentions, precipitates gift towards its end, is its very apocalypse [Hamacher], truth of gift > end of gift

H.content: delay and haste, halting and hastening, rhythm of Oedipus’ journey; p. 127 infinite speed contracted into an absolute halt or haste, precipitation because delay, instant of an instant that is canceled out > thus always late & precipitous re: hospitality
H.linkedContent: delay and haste, halting and hastening, rhythm of Oedipus’ journey; p. 127 infinite speed contracted into an absolute halt or haste, precipitation because delay, instant of an instant that is canceled out > thus always late & precipitous re: hospitality

SPOM.content: a trajectory without heading, assurance, a trajectory of a precipitation which trembles, vibrates, orients, disorients: the question here addressed to us under the name justice
SPOM.linkedContent: a trajectory without heading, assurance, a trajectory of a precipitation which trembles, vibrates, orients, disorients: the question here addressed to us under the name justice

SPOM.content: l’archarnement (ferocity, w/ chair, flesh) d’un chasseur > set out the living lifeless body of a ghost (le corps vivant sans vie d’un fantôme) to trick prey (pour tromper sa proie)
SPOM.linkedContent: l’archarnement (ferocity, w/ chair, flesh) d’un chasseur > set out the living lifeless body of a ghost (le corps vivant sans vie d’un fantôme) to trick prey (pour tromper sa proie)

SPOM.content: Derrida has a feeling about this, and it’s projected into what he’s doing: “it is never possible to avoid this precipitation, since everyone reads, acts, writes with his or her ghosts, even when one goes after the ghosts of others”
SPOM.linkedContent: Derrida has a feeling about this, and it’s projected into what he’s doing: “it is never possible to avoid this precipitation, since everyone reads, acts, writes with his or her ghosts, even when one goes after the ghosts of others”

MSUBJ.content: to speak of the subjectile, we must speak by insertion and precipitation, acceleration of rhythmical projection [see MPM p. 62] and inscription of projectile, beyond “words and images”
MSUBJ.linkedContent: to speak of the subjectile, we must speak by insertion and precipitation, acceleration of rhythmical projection [see MPM p. 62] and inscription of projectile, beyond “words and images”

MPM.content: [see p. 88n at what speed ought one to read?] motif of precipitousness in de Man, acceleration to win time, win time over, non-dialectical—not a particular rhythm—a rhythm w/out rhythm (incommensurable acceleration, infinite and null, touches the sublime)
MPM.linkedContent: [see p. 88n at what speed ought one to read?] motif of precipitousness in de Man, acceleration to win time, win time over, non-dialectical—not a particular rhythm—a rhythm w/out rhythm (incommensurable acceleration, infinite and null, touches the sublime)

MPM.content: de Man on Baudelaire: write so fast, precipitously, don’t let the phantom escape > a resurrection, a “ghost” story, “Lazarus, arise!”
MPM.linkedContent: de Man on Baudelaire: write so fast, precipitously, don’t let the phantom escape > a resurrection, a “ghost” story, “Lazarus, arise!”

A.content: for Heidegger, precipitous concepts of death not only a speculative failure, they introduce empirical or techno-juridical confusions becoming more serious today
A.linkedContent: for Heidegger, precipitous concepts of death not only a speculative failure, they introduce empirical or techno-juridical confusions becoming more serious today

PAS.content: Blanchot: she would only have precipitated through her death
PAS.linkedContent: Blanchot: she would only have precipitated through her death

OH.content: [Naas quotes from interview] precipitating contacts and articulations: dogmatism, confusion, opportunism [see POS p. 62]
OH.linkedContent: [Naas quotes from interview] precipitating contacts and articulations: dogmatism, confusion, opportunism [see POS p. 62]

OH.content: Derrida precipitates conclusion, which is movement of the head (chef)
OH.linkedContent: Derrida precipitates conclusion, which is movement of the head (chef)

POOF.content: one might insist the world can’t wait for bibliophilic decision, “esoteric rarity,” and yet event is always absolutely urgent, cutting, conclusive, heartrending (déchirante)
POOF.linkedContent: one might insist the world can’t wait for bibliophilic decision, “esoteric rarity,” and yet event is always absolutely urgent, cutting, conclusive, heartrending (déchirante)

P.content: lemmatic precipitation, anticipatory conceptualizing, recourse to metaphor of circle, circle of circles, metaphor of organic whole [re: Hegel & philosophy as work of art]
P.linkedContent: lemmatic precipitation, anticipatory conceptualizing, recourse to metaphor of circle, circle of circles, metaphor of organic whole [re: Hegel & philosophy as work of art]

P.content: wanting to avoid “repetition” at all costs, one can: rush toward false exit, empirical chit-chat (bavardage), spring-green impulsive avant-gardism (l’avant-gardism printanier ou primesautier)
P.linkedContent: wanting to avoid “repetition” at all costs, one can: rush toward false exit, empirical chit-chat (bavardage), spring-green impulsive avant-gardism (l’avant-gardism printanier ou primesautier)

P.content: who said it was necessary to avoid risk of “repetition”?
P.linkedContent: who said it was necessary to avoid risk of “repetition”?

OS.content: w/out rigorous critical/deconstruction of MOP, the very necessary attention to differences, coupures, mutations, leaps becomes ensnarled (s’encombre) in slogans, dogmatic stupidities, empiricist precipitation > and discourse “put in question” [takes you from behind]
OS.linkedContent: w/out rigorous critical/deconstruction of MOP, the very necessary attention to differences, coupures, mutations, leaps becomes ensnarled (s’encombre) in slogans, dogmatic stupidities, empiricist precipitation > and discourse “put in question” [takes you from behind]

PS.content: rush to essentiality, because there is nothing to say about the unique?
PS.linkedContent: rush to essentiality, because there is nothing to say about the unique?

FS.content: no knowledge can keep writing from its essential precipitation toward meaning (which writing constitutes, which is writing’s future)
FS.linkedContent: no knowledge can keep writing from its essential precipitation toward meaning (which writing constitutes, which is writing’s future)

O.content: Derrida includes long list of hasty breaks w/ idealism, precipitous leaps to the outside (i.e. expressivist practice of writing) > all of which would surely regress back
O.linkedContent: Derrida includes long list of hasty breaks w/ idealism, precipitous leaps to the outside (i.e. expressivist practice of writing) > all of which would surely regress back

FWT.content: “I can understand the vital urgency of an identitarian reflex” [see WAP pp. 3-4]
FWT.linkedContent: “I can understand the vital urgency of an identitarian reflex” [see WAP pp. 3-4]

WAP.content: certains sont toujours impatients d’accéder-directement-aux-choses-mêmes-et-d'atteindre-sans-attendre-tout-droit-le-vrai-contenu-des-problèmes-urgents-et-graves-qui-se-posent-à-tous-etc. > demand not to be slow, self-indulgent, has a history, a hypocritical structure
WAP.linkedContent: certains sont toujours impatients d’accéder-directement-aux-choses-mêmes-et-d'atteindre-sans-attendre-tout-droit-le-vrai-contenu-des-problèmes-urgents-et-graves-qui-se-posent-à-tous-etc. > demand not to be slow, self-indulgent, has a history, a hypocritical structure

WAP.content: “classes”—goes too fast [instead, Derrida says: certain groups or social circles w/ their dialects and subcodes]
WAP.linkedContent: “classes”—goes too fast [instead, Derrida says: certain groups or social circles w/ their dialects and subcodes]

SW.content: where do I get the force/desire to precipitate the verdict w/out end, to the end of time, to precipitate imminence? > my texts have pocketed veils & sails of every sex and gender [French?] (which clothed my entire history): the whole history of our culture in a pocket
SW.linkedContent: where do I get the force/desire to precipitate the verdict w/out end, to the end of time, to precipitate imminence? > my texts have pocketed veils & sails of every sex and gender [French?] (which clothed my entire history): the whole history of our culture in a pocket

CHM.content: violence of rationalists: good sense never divides itself enough, always determined too quickly
CHM.linkedContent: violence of rationalists: good sense never divides itself enough, always determined too quickly

CHM.content: Descartes interns his own hyperbole by temporalizing Cogito, certifying it through God (temporalizes the sharpest point, the instant), a hurried repatriation > God protects Descartes against madness of Cogito
CHM.linkedContent: Descartes interns his own hyperbole by temporalizing Cogito, certifying it through God (temporalizes the sharpest point, the instant), a hurried repatriation > God protects Descartes against madness of Cogito

Gi.content: re: Dasein, the precipitation or acceleration to neutralize man’s sexuality, and to do so first, cannot be neutral
Gi.linkedContent: re: Dasein, the precipitation or acceleration to neutralize man’s sexuality, and to do so first, cannot be neutral

Gi.content: to interpret as negative forces [re: Heidegger’s essential properties of Dasein]: precipitate interpretation, dialecticize
Gi.linkedContent: to interpret as negative forces [re: Heidegger’s essential properties of Dasein]: precipitate interpretation, dialecticize

Gii.content: Heidegger: 2 hands clutch in haste, utilitarian violence (want #, quantity), don’t have patience of 1—the essential is not #, it’s the right time (die rechte Zeit)
Gii.linkedContent: Heidegger: 2 hands clutch in haste, utilitarian violence (want #, quantity), don’t have patience of 1—the essential is not #, it’s the right time (die rechte Zeit)

REST.content: no hasty step here, la précipitation du pas, unavoidable w/ Van Gogh’s shoes? [p. 265 pas de préciptitation]
REST.linkedContent: no hasty step here, la précipitation du pas, unavoidable w/ Van Gogh’s shoes? [p. 265 pas de préciptitation]

REST.content: a contract of “impulsive or precritical naïveté” [all contracts?]
REST.linkedContent: a contract of “impulsive or precritical naïveté” [all contracts?]

PF.content: those who rush to confuse differance and alibi disavow that they are avoiding “thing itself,” which differance will never be; is differance a political alibi? an allegation destined to delay the deadline? no: w/out alibi is precisely a differance w/out alibi
PF.linkedContent: those who rush to confuse differance and alibi disavow that they are avoiding “thing itself,” which differance will never be; is differance a political alibi? an allegation destined to delay the deadline? no: w/out alibi is precisely a differance w/out alibi

HLP.content: to hurry to produce an “effect of truth” w/out a certain conscientiousness: neither to lie, nor to error, nor Arendt’s self-deception
HLP.linkedContent: to hurry to produce an “effect of truth” w/out a certain conscientiousness: neither to lie, nor to error, nor Arendt’s self-deception

LI.content: Derrida believes his insistence [re: a passage in SEC] should have prevented all haste & confusion [i.e. Sarl’s]
LI.linkedContent: Derrida believes his insistence [re: a passage in SEC] should have prevented all haste & confusion [i.e. Sarl’s]

OG.content: Lévi-Strauss’ ethnocentrism betrayed by haste of translation, satisfaction w/ domestic equivalents
OG.linkedContent: Lévi-Strauss’ ethnocentrism betrayed by haste of translation, satisfaction w/ domestic equivalents

OG.content: the foreigner has often been called stammerer or mute
OG.linkedContent: the foreigner has often been called stammerer or mute

UWC.content: [the event, the unconditional] matter of the sense of sense [meaning of meaning?] > up to you now, up to others—signatories are also addressees
UWC.linkedContent: [the event, the unconditional] matter of the sense of sense [meaning of meaning?] > up to you now, up to others—signatories are also addressees

UWC.content: take your time, but be quick: don’t know what awaits you
UWC.linkedContent: take your time, but be quick: don’t know what awaits you

SPEC.content: Freud’s haste, urgency, to solve the problem of beyond the PP is something other, of another order: not the demonstrative declaration or manifest argument [like Rousseau in OG]
SPEC.linkedContent: Freud’s haste, urgency, to solve the problem of beyond the PP is something other, of another order: not the demonstrative declaration or manifest argument [like Rousseau in OG]

FV.content: to designate the works of “young” Lacan: academics who hurry to cut to the quick that which doesn’t bear partition
FV.linkedContent: to designate the works of “young” Lacan: academics who hurry to cut to the quick that which doesn’t bear partition

CHOR.content: I am going too quickly, I’m schematizing excessively: Heidegger begins by denying all forms of security, all sedimented presuppositions of classical ontology
CHOR.linkedContent: I am going too quickly, I’m schematizing excessively: Heidegger begins by denying all forms of security, all sedimented presuppositions of classical ontology
